data.title: 25: Last Date, Courses & Fees, Updates
data.meta_description: July 20, 2024 KKHSOU Admission 2024-25: Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) came into existence in 2006 in Guwahati, Assam. The admission July session for the 2024 academic year is ongoing and the last expected date to submit the online form is 31st July 2024. This is an open university accredited by UGC-DEB to provide online distance learning mode. on the official portal @kkhsou.ac.in. The application fees are INR 500 for UG and INR 600 for PG programs. Eligibility for UG courses is 10+2 with a minimum of 50% marks, and for PG courses, a bachelor’s degree with at least 50% marks is required. SC/ST candidates get a 5% relaxation in eligibility criteria, and OBC candidates get a 3% relaxation.
data.text:
KKHSOU Admission 2024-25: Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) came into existence in 2006 in Guwahati, Assam. The admission July session for the 2024 academic year is ongoing and the last expected date to submit the online form is 31st July 2024. This is an open university accredited by UGC-DEB to provide online distance learning mode. on the official portal @kkhsou.ac.in. The application fees are INR 500 for UG and INR 600 for PG programs. Eligibility for UG courses is 10+2 with a minimum of 50% marks, and for PG courses, a bachelor’s degree with at least 50% marks is required. SC/ST candidates get a 5% relaxation in eligibility criteria, and OBC candidates get a 3% relaxation.

Undergraduate course

The different undergraduate courses are BBA, BCA, B.Com, Bachelor of Arts in Economics, History, Sociology, and more. This is a 3-year course with 6 semesters.

Postgraduate Courses

M.A. in Education, MSW, M.A.J.MC, M.Com, M.B.A, and more are postgraduate courses which are offered in this university.

Diploma Programs

Different Diploma programs are Diploma in Journalism and Mass Communication, Library and Information Science, etcetera.

Eligibility Criteria

Students are required to complete their 10+2 exam with 60% to pursue undergraduate courses.

Candidates need to qualify for level courses to be admitted to a Postgraduate program. The minimum qualifying marks required in Bacher’s is 50% of total marks.

For pursuing Diploma program students must pass 12th from the same or equivalent stream from an accredited board.

KKHSOU Admission Latest Update

KKHSOU admission is open for the July session academic year 2024-25, Candidates can apply through the official website portal provided by the university before the deadline 31 July 2024. Source

KKHSOU Admission Headline

University Name Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) Short Name KKHSOU Mode of Education Open and Distance Learning Departments Arts, Commerce, Management, Computer Applications, Social Work, and more Popular Courses BA, BCom, BBA, BCA, MA, MCom, MBA, MSc IT Mode of Admission Merit-based Selection Criteria Qualifying Degree and Marks Entrance Exam No Entrance Exam for Most Courses University Type State Open University University Website www.kkhsou.in Application Fee INR 300

KKHSOU Admission 2024-25

Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) offers a diverse array of undergraduate, postgraduate, and diploma courses through its distance education platform. Here’s everything you need to know to apply for the upcoming academic session:

Undergraduate (UG) Courses:

Courses Offered: BA, BCom, BBA, BCA, and more.

Eligibility Criteria: Candidates must have completed their Higher Secondary Examination (10+2) from a recognized board with a minimum of 45% marks.

Application Process: Apply online via the official website.

Application Fee: INR 500 for general category students, INR 250 for SC/ST candidates.

Postgraduate (PG) Programs:

Courses Offered: MA, MCom, MBA, MSc IT, and others.

Eligibility Criteria: A bachelor’s degree in the relevant field with at least 50% marks.

Special Requirements: Specific programs like B.Ed. may require a graduation degree and teaching experience.

Application Process: Apply online through the official website.

Application Fee: INR 500 for general category students, INR 250 for SC/ST candidates.

Diploma and Certificate Courses:

Courses Offered: Diploma in Creative Writing in English, PGDCA, Certificate Courses in Human Rights, and more.

Eligibility: Criteria vary by course; check the official website for details.

Application Process: Apply online via the official website.

Application Fee: INR 500 for general category students, INR 250 for SC/ST candidates.

Admission Overview:

Selection Process: Admission is primarily based on the marks obtained in the qualifying examination. No entrance exams are required for most programs.

Reservations: KKHSOU follows government guidelines for reservations, including provisions for SC, ST, OBC, PWD, economically weaker sections, and rural candidates.

Important Dates for KKHSOU Admission 2024:

Pre-registration Deadline: 31 July 2024.

KKHSOU University Entrance Examination

Undergraduate Entrance Examinations

KKHSOU does not conduct entrance examinations for admission to most of its undergraduate (UG) programs. Admissions are granted based on merit, determined by the scores obtained in the qualifying examination, such as 10+2 or equivalent.

Postgraduate Entrance Examinations

Similar to UG programs, KKHSOU does not require postgraduate (PG) entrance examinations for most of its courses. Admissions to PG programs, including Master of Arts (MA), Master of Commerce (MCom), Master of Business Administration (MBA), and Master of Science in Information Technology (MSc IT), are based on merit, determined by the marks obtained in the relevant bachelor’s degree.

However, KKHSOU may introduce entrance examinations or additional selection criteria for specific courses in the future. Prospective students are advised to regularly check the university’s website or contact the admission helpline for the latest information regarding entrance examinations or any changes in the admission process.

KKHSOU University UG and PG Course Admission 2024-25

Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) offers a diverse range of undergraduate (UG) and postgraduate (PG) programs, catering to students’ academic interests and career aspirations. Let’s delve into the details of these programs:

KKHSOU Undergraduate Courses (UG)

Bachelor of Arts (BA): Eligibility – 10+2 or equivalent, Duration – 3 years, Selection – Merit-based

Bachelor of Commerce (BCom): Eligibility – 10+2 with a minimum of 50% marks, Duration – 3 years, Selection – Merit-based

Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA): Eligibility – 10+2 or equivalent, Duration – 3 years, Selection – Merit-based

Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA): Eligibility – 10+2 or equivalent, with or without Mathematics, Duration – 3 years, Selection – Merit-based

KKHSOU Postgraduate Courses (PG)

Master of Arts (MA): Eligibility – Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 50% marks, Duration – 2 years, Selection – Merit-based

Specializations available: Assamese, English, Education, Political Science, Sociology, and more

Master of Commerce (MCom): Eligibility – Bachelor of Commerce (BCom) with a minimum of 50% marks, Duration – 2 years, Selection – Merit-based

Master of Business Administration (MBA): Eligibility – Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 50% marks, Duration – 2 years, Selection – Merit-based

Master of Science in Information Technology (MSc IT): Eligibility – Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 50% marks, Duration – 2 years, Selection – Merit-based

Diploma and Certificate Courses

KKHSOU also offers a wide range of diploma and certificate courses, including:

Diploma in Library and Information Science

Diploma in Sanskrit Learning

Diploma in Yoga (Kaya Yogi)

Diploma in Computer Science

Diploma in Business Management

Diploma in Human Resource Management

Diploma in Broadcast Journalism

Diploma in Mass Communication

Diploma in Yoga

Diploma in Sales and Marketing Management

Certificate for Security Personnel

Certificate in Counseling Skills

Certificate Program in Welding and Cutting

Certificate Program in Electrical House Wiring

Post Graduate Certificate Program in Geoinformatics

Certificate Course in Japanese Language and Culture

Management UG PG Course Admission 2024-25

Course Eligibility Duration Selection BBA 10+2 or equivalent 3 years Merit-based MBA Bachelor’s degree with 50% marks 2 years Merit-based

Technology UG PG Course Admission 2024-25

Course Eligibility Duration Selection BCA 10+2 or equivalent (with or without Mathematics) 3 years Merit-based MSc IT Bachelor’s degree with 50% marks 2 years Merit-based

Other Courses Admission 2024-25

Course Eligibility Duration Selection BA 10+2 or equivalent 3 years Merit-based MA Bachelor’s degree with 50% marks 2 years Merit-based BCom 10+2 with 50% marks 3 years Merit-based MCom BCom with 50% marks 2 years Merit-based

Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) Admission 2024: Your Complete Guide

Krishna Kanta Handiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) has simplified the admission process for the 2024 academic session, ensuring it’s accessible for all prospective students. Here’s everything you need to know about applying:

Application for KKHSOU: Step-by-Step Guide

Visit the Official Website: Go to www.kkhsou.in and click on the “Admissions” section.

Online Application:

Click on “Apply Online” and create an account by entering your name, contact details, and email address.

Log in to your account and fill out the application form with accurate information about your personal details, academic background, and chosen course.

Document Upload:

Upload scanned copies of essential documents such as marksheets, certificates, photographs, signatures, and identification proof.

Review and Submit:

Double-check all entered information for accuracy before proceeding to the payment section.

Pay the application fee of INR 300 through secure online payment modes like credit/debit card, net banking, or UPI.

Confirmation and Print:

After successful payment, submit your application and keep a printed copy of the form for future reference.

Offline Application Option:

For those preferring offline mode, visit the university’s admission office and follow the instructions provided.

Required Documents:

Passport-size photographs

Class 10th and 12th marksheets and certificates

Bachelor’s degree marksheets and certificate (for PG courses)

Category certificate (if applicable, e.g., SC/ST/OBC)

Valid photo ID proof (Aadhaar card, voter ID, passport, etc.)

Migration certificate (if applicable)

Scanned copy of signature

Date of birth certificate

Scholarship Opportunities:

KKHSOU offers various scholarships based on merit, financial need, and reserved categories like SC/ST.

Check the university’s website for detailed eligibility criteria and application procedures.

KKHSOU Career Support and Alumni Success:

Although focused on distance education, KKHSOU collaborates with industries for internships and job opportunities.

The university emphasizes skill development through workshops to enhance employability.

Conclusion:
